Sample Data

Source: R/AllGenerics.R, R/sampleData-methods.R, R/sampleNames-methods.R
sampleData.Rd

Metadata that describes the samples.

sampleData(object, ...)

sampleData(object, ...) <- value

# S4 method for SummarizedExperiment
sampleData(object)

# S4 method for SummarizedExperiment,DataFrame
sampleData(object) <- value

# S4 method for SingleCellExperiment
sampleData(object,
  blacklist = c("^ident$", "^origIdent$", "^res[.0-9]+$", "^sScore$",
  "^g2mScore$", "^phase$"))

# S4 method for SingleCellExperiment,DataFrame
sampleData(object) <- value

# S4 method for SummarizedExperiment
sampleNames(object)

Arguments

object

Object.
...

Additional arguments.
value

Value to assign.
blacklist

character. Column names that should never be treated as sample-level metadata. Applies to objects where the columns don't map to samples (e.g. SingleCellExperiment), and we need to collapse the colData() dynamically.

Value

DataFrame.

Details

This is a complement to the standard colData() function, but improves support for accessing sample metadata for datasets where multiple items in the columns map to a single sample (e.g. cells for a single-cell RNA-seq experiment).

See also

Other Metadata Functions: detectHPC, detectLanes, detectOrganism, interestingGroups, microplate, minimalSampleData, organism, sampleNames, uniteInterestingGroups

Other SummarizedExperiment Functions: counts, interestingGroups, makeSummarizedExperiment, mapGenes, meltCounts, metrics, sampleNames, selectSamples, tpm

Examples

data(rse_small, sce_small)

## SummarizedExperiment ====
x <- rse_small
sampleData(x)
#> DataFrame with 4 rows and 4 columns
#>         genotype treatment sampleName interestingGroups
#>         <factor>  <factor>   <factor>          <factor>
#> sample1 wildtype   control    sample1  wildtype:control
#> sample2 knockout   control    sample2  knockout:control
#> sample3 wildtype   treated    sample3  wildtype:treated
#> sample4 knockout   treated    sample4  knockout:treated

## Assignment support
sampleData(x)[["batch"]] <- 1L
## `batch` column should be now defined.
sampleData(x)
#> DataFrame with 4 rows and 5 columns
#>         genotype treatment sampleName     batch interestingGroups
#>         <factor>  <factor>   <factor> <integer>          <factor>
#> sample1 wildtype   control    sample1         1  wildtype:control
#> sample2 knockout   control    sample2         1  knockout:control
#> sample3 wildtype   treated    sample3         1  wildtype:treated
#> sample4 knockout   treated    sample4         1  knockout:treated

## SingleCellExperiment ====
x <- sce_small
sampleData(x)
#> DataFrame with 2 rows and 2 columns
#>         sampleName interestingGroups
#>           <factor>          <factor>
#> sample2    sample2           sample2
#> sample1    sample1           sample1

## Assignment support.
sampleData(x)[["batch"]] <- 1L
## `batch` column should be now defined.
sampleData(x)
#> DataFrame with 2 rows and 3 columns
#>         sampleName     batch interestingGroups
#>           <factor> <integer>          <factor>
#> sample2    sample2         1           sample2
#> sample1    sample1         1           sample1
